00045 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00046 // Constructor
00047 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00048 
00049 MACSimClient::MACSimClient(SimStruct *p_S) : Sim(p_S)
00050 {
00051 
00052         // Haven't created anything yet
00053         m_client = NULL;
00054         m_inPacket = NULL;
00055         m_outPacket = NULL;
00056 
00057         // Attempt to construct a client pipe interface
00058         try
00059         {
00060                 m_client = new Client();
00061         }
00062         catch (ClientException e)
00063         {
00064                 // Re-throw as a sim Exception
00065                 throw Exception(e.getDescription());
00066         }
00067 
00068         // Add a discrete interface that matches the inputs and outputs required
00069         // by the MACSim server.  We don't need any Simulink controlled states or
00070         // parameters.  MACSim uses a single sample time for both input and
00071         // output ports.
00072         m_interface = addDiscreteInterface("MACSim",
00073                                                                            m_client->getNumInputs(), 
00074                                                                            m_client->getNumOutputs(), 
00075                                                                            0, 0, 
00076                                                                            m_client->getSampleTime());
00077                                                                            
00078         // Setup the input and output IOPackets
00079         m_inPacket = new IOPacketWrapper(m_client->getNumInputs());
00080         m_outPacket = new IOPacket(m_client->getNumOutputs());
00081 }
00082 
00083 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00084 // Destructor
00085 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00086 
00087 MACSimClient::~MACSimClient()
00088 {
00089         
00090         // Don't need to delete interface, this is done for us
00091         
00092         // Delete pipe client
00093         if (m_client != NULL) 
00094                 delete m_client;
00095 
00096         // Delete the input and output IOPackets
00097         if (m_inPacket != NULL)
00098                 delete m_inPacket;
00099         if (m_outPacket != NULL)
00100                 delete m_outPacket;
00101 }
00102 
00103 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00104 // Output function
00105 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00106 
00107 void MACSimClient::output()
00108 {
00109         
00110         // Set the values, u must be copied
00111         for(int i = 0; i < m_inPacket->m_nValues; i++)
00112         {
00113                 m_inPacket->m_values[i] = m_interface->u(i);
00114         }
00115         
00116         // However, there is a shortcut for y
00117         m_outPacket->m_values = &m_interface->y(0);
00118         
00119         // Request new outputs from the client
00120         m_client->getSimOutputs(m_inPacket, m_outPacket);
00121 }
